UtenlandsoppholdSteg.Siste12Måneder.Spør: Where have you lived in the last 12 months?
UtenlandsoppholdSteg.Siste12Måneder.IsRe: You must state where you have lived in the last 12 months
UtenlandsoppholdSteg.Siste12MånederInfot: I have lived abroad either fully or partially
UtenlandsoppholdSteg.Neste12Måneder.Spør: Where are you going to live for the next 12 months?
UtenlandsoppholdSteg.Neste12Måneder.IsRe: You must enter where you are going to live for the next 12 months
UtenlandsoppholdSteg.Neste12MånederInfot: I will live abroad either fully or partially
UtenlandsoppholdSteg.HjelpeTekstFelles.T: Stays abroad and support from Nav
UtenlandsoppholdSteg.HjelpeTekstFelles.D: To be entitled to support from Nav, you must be a member of the Norwegian National Insurance Scheme. People who live in Norway are usually members of the National Insurance Scheme.
Whether you keep your membership in the National Insurance Scheme during your stay abroad depends on where you will be staying and how long you will be there.

When you will be abroad for more than 12 months, we consider you to be resident abroad according to the Norwegian National Insurance Act's rules. The same applies if you will be abroad for more than 6 months a year for 2 or more consecutive calendar years.
You are no longer a member of the National Insurance Scheme when you are considered resident abroad.

When you are on holiday abroad, you are considered a tourist and retain your membership in the National Insurance Scheme, if you have no income from work during your stay and your stay does not last longer than 12 months. As long as you are a member of the National Insurance Scheme, you generally retain the benefit.
You can read more about parental benefit and stays abroad.
You can read more about maternity allowance and stays abroad.
UtenlandsoppholdSteg.HjelpeTekstES.Titte: Membership in the National Insurance Scheme
To be entitled to a lump-sum grant from Nav, you must have been a continuous member of the Norwegian National Insurance Scheme for at least 12 months immediately before the due date. If you are adopting, you must have been a continuous member of the National Insurance Scheme for at least 12 months immediately before the adoption date. If you live in Norway, you are usually a member of the National Insurance Scheme.
Whether you keep your membership in the National Insurance Scheme during a stay abroad depends on where you will be staying and how long you will be there.

If you will be abroad for more than 12 months, we consider you to be residing abroad according to the rules of the National Insurance Act. The same applies if, in two or more consecutive calendar years, you will be abroad for more than 6 months a year.
You are no longer a member of the National Insurance Scheme when you are considered to be residing abroad.

When you are on vacation abroad, you are considered a tourist and retain your membership in the National Insurance Scheme, provided you do not have work income during your stay and the stay does not last longer than 12 months. As long as you are a member of the National Insurance Scheme, you generally retain the benefit.
You can read more about lump-sum grant and stays abroad.

TidligereUtenlandsoppholdSteg.Spørsmål.H: What country did you live in?

TidligereUtenlandsoppholdSteg.Utenlandso: The date has to before the to date
The date has to be after the from date
